intro: Dissochaeta glandiformis, commonly known as the glandular dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular leaves that are often covered in fine, sticky hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Dissochaeta glandiformis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
